comments.html: Why not use OpenDNS (www.opendns.com) instead of crappy ISP DNS servers?  At that rate you gain phishing protection, domain name auto-correction, filtering (if you set up an account) and of course much faster and ultra fault tolerance by way of anycast usage.  I don't work for or am affiliated in OpenDNS in any way, but they sure do rock!

You can also import the ipcp negotiated DNS server(s) into a dhcp profile by using:
"import all"

This means you don't need to run the dns server on the cisco box.
